TextBody:

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. I'm Rej and I'll be assisting you today.

If you login to your Netwrix account (https://www.netwrix.com), you should be able to view your available downloads with the latest update. If you don't have a login, you can register using your company domain account and the download should be available for you.

Let me know if you need anymore assistance.

Thank you,

Rej Uddin

Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #442721 - Ping Castle Pro Update

TextBody:
Hello Damian,

Please follow the guide to upgrading PingCastle Pro to the newest version:

Netwrix PingCastle Pro Upgrade Guide

We recommend backing up your database and original PingCastlePro directory and follow the steps:


	Download the upgrade pack zip file
	Stop IIS
	Upgrade ASP.NET 8 from 3.2 to 3.3
	Extract the zip over the installation directory
	Ensure pre-requisites are met
	Start IIS


Let us know if you need anymore assistance.

Thank you,

Rej Uddin

Technical Support Team Lead

Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749

TextBody:
Hello Damian,

There is a slight bug with PingCastlePro where the license is applied but when running the report it still says basic edition however when checking the report it shows the full Pro edition. Was the appsettings.production.json file updated with your Pro license?

Thank you,

TextBody:
Hello Damian,

Thank you for taking the time to meet today.

Today we:
Viewed both the old and new directory for PingCastlePro and checked the licensing
Saw that the old version license worked but the new version the license doesn't apply at all


Our next steps are:
Follow up with my team and discuss what the best options are.
Most likely we will provide you with a new license as this is a bug in the current version.

We will let you know as soon as we get an answer

Thank you,

Rej Uddin

TextBody:
Hello Damian,

Thank you for the update. Because you have setup the API correctly, the --api-key will retrieve the license. I believe the licence within appsettings.json file is only for the web interface and not for the PingCastle.exe. The scheduler should work properly because of this. Do you need anything else?

Thank you,

Rej Uddin

Technical Support Team Lead
